title: Utility functions for project
text: repository project template create data harmonisation reports using R Quarto books. learn Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.

title: Utility functions for project
text: file structure project. Back top
code: harmonisation_template/                   # Root of the compendium │ ├── harmonisation_template.Rproj          # RStudio project file | ├── .quarto/                              # Intermediate files/folders generated  |                                         # Quarto renders to the documents. | ├── archive/                              # Folder to keep previous books and harmonised data │   ├── reports/                          # Folder containing previous documentation  |   |                                     # of data harmonisation  |   └── harmonised/                       # Folder containing previous GPS-CAD harmonised data |   ├── reports/                              # Documentation of data harmonisation  │   ├── data-raw/                             # Cohort raw data (.csv, .gpkg, etc.) │   ├── {cohort name}/                    # Folder containing cohort raw data, |   |                                     # and data dictionary  |   └── data-dictionary/                  # Data dictionary for harmonised data |   └── data-input/                       # Data input file from collaborators |   ├── docs/                                 # R functions documentation generating using |                                         # pkgdown:::build_site_external() |   ├── inst/                                 # Arbitrary additional files to include in the |   |                                     # package. |   |   |   └── WORDLIST                          # File generating by spelling::update_wordlist() |   ├── man/                                  # R functions helps (automatically updated) │   ├── {fun-demo}.Rd                     # Documentation of the demo R function │   └── harmonisation-template.Rd         # High-level documentation |   ├── quarto-yaml-template/                 # Folder containing template files for quarto book generation │   ├── _quarto_{cohort name}.yml         # Quarto book generation for each cohort │   └── _quarto_all.yml                   # Quarto book generation for all cohorts |   ├── R/                                    # R functions location │   ├── {fun-demo}.R                      # Example of an R function │   └── harmonisation-template-package.R  # Dummy R file for high-level documentation │   ├── renv/                                 # Folder that contains all packages  |                                         # installed in the renv environment. |         ├── codes/                                # R/Quarto scripts to run data harmonisation |   ├── quarto_script.R                   # R script to render each {cohort name}_Cleaning/ folder.  |   |                                     # folder into html, pdf and word document. │   ├── {cohort name}_Cleaning/           # Quarto scripts to run data harmonisation |   |                                     # and output them for each cohort. |   └── Combine/                          # Quarto scripts to filter harmonised data |                                         # based on inclusion/exclusion criteria,  |   |                                     # combined the filtered data for preliminary analysis. |         ├── tests/                                # Test units file created by R package testhat │         ├── .lintr                                # Configuration for linting |                                         # R projects and packages using linter |         ├── .Rbuildignore                         # List of files/folders to be ignored while  │                                         # checking/installing the package |         ├── .renvignore                           # List of files/folders to be ignored when  │                                         # renv is doing its snapshot |         ├── _pkgdown.yml                          # Configuration for R package documentation |                                         # using pkgdown:::build_site_external() |         ├── _quarto.yml                           # Configuration for Quarto book generation |                                         # Also the project configuration file |         ├── custom-reference.docx                 # Microsoft word template for data harmonisation  |                                         # documentation to Word |         ├── DESCRIPTION                           # Project metadata[*] |         ├── index.qmd                             # Home page of Quarto book content |         ├── LICENSE                               # Content of the MIT license generated via |                                         # usethis::use_mit_license() ├── LICENSE.md                            # Content of the MIT license generated via |                                         # usethis::use_mit_license() |         ├── NAMESPACE                             # Automatically generated │         ├── README.md                             # GitHub README (automatically generated) ├── README.Rmd                            # GitHub README (ignore for now) │       |       ├── references.bib                        # Bibtex file for Quarto book  |       ├── references.qmd                        # Reference document for Quarto book |       ├── renv.lock                             # Metadata of R packages installed generated |                                         # using renv::snapshot |       ├── csl_file.csl                          # Citation Style Language (CSL) file to ensure |                                         # citations follows the Lancet journal   [*] These files are automatically created but user needs to manually add some information.

title: Utility functions for project
text: Go https://cran.rstudio.com/. Choose version R matches computer’s operating system.

title: Utility functions for project
text: Go https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/. Scroll choose version RStudio matches computer’s operating system.

title: Utility functions for project
text: Go https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/. Choose version Rtools matches R version installed.

title: Utility functions for project
text: Quarto converts R scripts technical report notebook html, pdf, Microsoft Word, etc. installed together RStudio. User can also go https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/ install separately. Quarto able create pdf files, pdf engine must installed well. ease, suggested install TinyTex using terminal command quarto install tinytex.

title: Utility functions for project
text: Use Posit Public Package Manager PPM set repository environment install R packages CRAN. PPM allows installation frozen R package versions based snapshot date. One way set .Rprofile file code options(repos = c(P3M = "{link repository url form Posit Public Package Manager}")) R packages can installed using package pak alternative install.packages() remotes::install_github(). Benefits using pak can found can also view respository environment using command pak::repo_get() R package can loaded using command library({package_name}). can use R package annotater add additional information loaded package . Back top

title: Utility functions for project
text: can increase reproducibility using package renv. Install renv CRAN pak::pak("renv"). first time using renv, start Introduction renv vignette. Use renv::init(bare = TRUE) start empty renv environment. renv freeze exact package versions depend (renv.lock). ensures collaborator (future) use exact versions packages. Moreover renv provides project private package library making project isolated others. Install required dependencies locally install.packages() renv::install() CRAN, Bioconductor, Github, explicit file path, etc. Sometimes right downloader (libcurl others) needs set installation R packages inside renv environment successful. Setting R environmental variable RENV_DOWNLOAD_FILE_METHOD = “libcurl” may help. Save local environment renv::snapshot() create renv.lock file. Back top

title: Utility functions for project
text: R functions heavily used project can found R folder. Documentation (man folder), test units (test folder) corresponding functions structured creating R package. Relevant R packages required R package development (available Posit Public Package Manager PPM) example command use pak::pak("{package name}") install packages PPM. need source functions R folder. Use devtools::load_all() instead. devtools::load_all() load required dependencies listed DESCRIPTION R functions stored R/. Prior installation dependencies required load successful. loading, R functions can documented (using devtools::document()), tested (using devtools::test() devtools::check()) even installed R package (using devtools::install). information workflow can found Chapter 1: Whole Game R Packages (2e) book.
code: library("usethis") library("devtools") library("roxygen2") library("testthat") library("covr") library("spelling") library("lintr") library("sinew") library("pkgdown")

title: Utility functions for project
text: R packages installed Posit Public Package Manager PPM using command pak::pak("{package name}") R packages used analysis. Back top
code: library("renv") library("sessioninfo") library("knitr") library("rmarkdown") library("quarto") library("rlang") library("cli")  library("fs") library("here") library("fst") library("readxl") library("vroom")  library("dplyr") library("tidyr") library("magrittr") library("stringr") library("forcats") library("purrr") library("tibble") library("glue")  library("collateral") library("pointblank") library("testthat")  library("htmltools") library("htmlwidgets") library("fontawesome") library("reactable") library("flextable") library("ftExtra")  library("openxlsx")  library("harmonisation") harmonisation::get_r_package_info() |>    knitr::kable()

title: Utility functions for project
text: R platform environment used analysis. Back top
code: harmonisation::get_r_platform_info() |>    knitr::kable()

title: Utility functions for project
text: DESCRIPTION file contains important compendium metadata. Though DESCRIPTION file specific R package, can used work research compendia (see ). information edit file, please read https://r-pkgs.org/description.html. Back top

title: Utility functions for project
text: start harmonisation data, run R script quarto_script.R reports folder. cohort, script clean raw data create Quarto book cohort html, word pdf. involves copying specific yml file (_quarto_{cohort name}.yml) quarto-yaml-template folder project folder harmonisation_template rename _quarto.yml, overwriting existing _quarto.yml file. Using _quarto.yml file. Quarto start running Quarto scripts reports/{cohort_name}_Cleaning folder. involves reading raw data data-raw/{cohort_name} folder, placing preprocessing data reports/{cohort_name}_Cleaning/preprocessed_data folder, outputting harmonised data excel file called cleaned_{cohort_name}.xlsx reports folder. Also, data harmonisation process documentation created books/{cohort_name} folder Quarto book html, word pdf. data harmonisation, data combining cohorts, data filtering preliminary analysis done copying _quarto_Prelim.yml file quarto-yaml-template folder project folder harmonisation_template rename _quarto.yml, overwriting existing _quarto.yml file. Using _quarto.yml file, Quarto runs Quarto scripts reports/Combine folder. Results outputted excel files called harmonised.xlsx, harmonised_batch1.xlsx, harmonised_batch2.xlsx reports folder. addition, preliminary results created books/Prelim folder Quarto book html, word pdf. cohort, script create combined data harmonisation process documentation (cohorts) Quarto book html. specific yml file (_quarto_all.yml) quarto-yaml-template folder used documentation created books/folder. Data combining cohorts, data filtering preliminary analysis also done running Quarto scripts reports/Combine folder. Back top

title: Utility functions for project
text: Ensure workspace always blank state. Use usethis::use_blank_slate(scope = c("user", "project")) create setting. Keep root project clean possible Store raw data data-raw Document raw data modifications. See Flowchart.xlsx. Export modified raw data reports/{cohort_name}_Cleaning/preprocessed_data Store R functions R/ Store R scripts /qmd reports/{cohort_name}_Cleaning Built relative paths using ::() Call external functions {package_name}::{function()} Use devtools::document() update NAMESPACE Use rcompendium::add_dependencies update list required dependencies DESCRIPTION source functions use instead devtools::load_all(). devtools::load_all() load required dependencies listed DESCRIPTION R functions stored R/ Back top

title: Add Cohort Name — add_cohort_name
text: Add cohort name new column dataset move first column.

title: Add Cohort Name — add_cohort_name
code: add_cohort_name(input_data, cohort_name, cohort_name_column = "cohort_name")

title: Add Cohort Name — add_cohort_name
text: input_data input data data frame tibble. cohort_name text indicating name cohort cohort_name_column text indicating column name used represent name cohort. Default: 'cohort_name'

title: Add Cohort Name — add_cohort_name
text: data frame new column called input text `cohort_name_column` containing character vector input text `cohort_name`.

title: Add Cohort Name — add_cohort_name
text: error raised input `cohort_name_column` already column name `input_data`. Currently, overriding columns allowed.

title: Add Cohort Name — add_cohort_name
code: input_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~column_a, ~column_b,   1, "Yes",   1, "No")  cohort_name = "Cohort 1"  result_data <- input_data |>   add_cohort_name(cohort_name = "Cohort 1",                   cohort_name_column = "cohorts")  result_data #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   cohorts  column_a column_b #>   <chr>       <dbl> <chr>    #> 1 Cohort 1        1 Yes      #> 2 Cohort 1        1 No

title: Calculate Column Maximum Character — calculate_column_max_char
text: Calculate maximum number characters column input data frame tibble, including column name.

title: Calculate Column Maximum Character — calculate_column_max_char
code: calculate_column_max_char(data)

title: Calculate Column Maximum Character — calculate_column_max_char
text: data Input tibble data frame.

title: Calculate Column Maximum Character — calculate_column_max_char
text: numeric vector value indicated maximum number characters column input data frame tibble.

title: Calculate Column Maximum Character — calculate_column_max_char
code: coronary_vessel_segments <- c(   "LM", "pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD",   "pLCX", "dLCX", "pRCA", "mRCA", "dRCA" )  vessel_severity <- c(   "Severe", "Severe", "Minimal", "Occluded",   "Moderate", "Moderate", "Normal", "Severe", "Mild" )   vessel_disease_data <- data.frame(   coronary_vessel_segments = coronary_vessel_segments,   vessel_severity = vessel_severity )  column_max_char <- calculate_column_max_char(vessel_disease_data)  column_max_char #> [1] 24 15

what: Create Drop Down Filter Render Function — create_dropdown_filter_render_function
title: Create Drop Down Filter Render Function — create_dropdown_filter_render_function
text: Function returns `reactable` filter input render function provide drop functionality.

title: Create Drop Down Filter Render Function — create_dropdown_filter_render_function
code: create_dropdown_filter_render_function(   reactable_element_id,   style = "width: 100%; height: 100%;" )

title: Create Drop Down Filter Render Function — create_dropdown_filter_render_function
text: reactable_element_id Text input indicating element ID `reactable` style Text input indicating javascript style parameters filter input drop box. Default: 'width: 100%; height: 28px;'

title: Create Drop Down Filter Render Function — create_dropdown_filter_render_function
text: render function `reactable` column indicating needs drop filter input box.

title: Create Drop Down Filter Render Function — create_dropdown_filter_render_function
code: create_dropdown_filter_render_function(   reactable_element_id = "drop-down-filter-table") #> function (values, name)  #> { #>     htmltools::tags$select(onchange = sprintf("\n          const value = event.target.value\n          Reactable.setFilter('%s', '%s', value === '__ALL__' ? undefined : value)",  #>         reactable_element_id, name), htmltools::tags$option(value = "__ALL__",  #>         "All"), lapply(intersect(levels(values), unique(values)),  #>         htmltools::tags$option), `aria-label` = sprintf("Filter %s",  #>         name), style = style) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x0000024494a1b3f0> #> <environment: 0x0000024494a1a200>

title: Get Max Stenosis Severity — get_max_stenosis_severity
text: Obtain highest level stenosis severity coronary vessel data.

title: Get Max Stenosis Severity — get_max_stenosis_severity
code: get_max_stenosis_severity(vessel_data, stenosis_severity_grp_column)

title: Get Max Stenosis Severity — get_max_stenosis_severity
text: vessel_data Input coronary vessel data stenosis_severity_grp_column Column `vessel_data` indicating severity level different coronary vessels. Accepted severity levels Normal (0% stenosis) Minimal (1 24% stenosis) Mild (25 49% stenosis) Moderate (50 69% stenosis) Severe (70 99% stenosis) Occluded (100% stenosis)

title: Get Max Stenosis Severity — get_max_stenosis_severity
text: text indicating highest level stenosis severity coronary vessel data.

title: Get Max Stenosis Severity — get_max_stenosis_severity
text: Cury et. al. (2022), Society Cardiovascular Computed Tomography (SCCT) graded luminal stenosis follows: Normal (0% stenosis) Minimal (1 24% stenosis) Mild (25 49% stenosis) Moderate (50 69% stenosis) Severe (70 99% stenosis) Occluded (100% stenosis)

title: Get Max Stenosis Severity — get_max_stenosis_severity
code: occluded_coronary_vessel_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~coronary_vessel, ~vessel_severity,   "LM", "Normal",   "LAD", "Severe",   "LCX", "Minimal",   "RCA", "Occluded" )  max_stenosis_severity <- get_max_stenosis_severity(   occluded_coronary_vessel_data,   "vessel_severity" )  max_stenosis_severity #> [1] "Occluded"

what: Get number of vessels with high stenosis severity — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity
title: Get number of vessels with high stenosis severity — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity
text: Get number vessels stenosis severity 50

title: Get number of vessels with high stenosis severity — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity
code: get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity(   vessel_data,   vessel_name_column,   stenosis_severity_grp_column,   lad_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LAD",   lcx_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LCX",   rca_vessel_segments_grp_name = "RCA",   lad_vessel_segments = c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD", "Diag1", "Diag2", "Diag3", "Diag4",     "Ramus1", "Ramus2"),   lcx_vessel_segments = c("pLCX", "dLCX", "LPDA", "LPL", "OM1", "OM2", "OM3", "OM4",     "OM5"),   rca_vessel_segments = c("pRCA", "mRCA", "dRCA", "RPDA", "RPL") )

title: Get number of vessels with high stenosis severity — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity
text: vessel_data Input coronary vessel data vessel_name_column Column `vessel_data` indicating different vessel segments LM, LAD, LCX RCA. stenosis_severity_grp_column Column `vessel_data` indicating severity level different coronary vessels. Accepted severity levels Normal (0% stenosis) Minimal (1 24% stenosis) Mild (25 49% stenosis) Moderate (50 69% stenosis) Severe (70 99% stenosis) Occluded (100% stenosis) lad_vessel_segments_grp_name Name vessel segment group indicate left anterior descending LAD vessels. Default: 'LAD' lcx_vessel_segments_grp_name Name vessel segment group indicate left circumflex LCX vessels. Default: 'LCX' rca_vessel_segments_grp_name Name vessel segment group indicate right coronary artery RCA. Default: 'RCA' lad_vessel_segments Name vessel segments `vessel_name_column` grouped left anterior descending LAD vessels. Default: c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD", "Diag1",            "Diag2", "Diag3", "Diag4",            "Ramus1", "Ramus2") lcx_vessel_segments Name vessel segments `vessel_name_column` grouped left circumflex LCX vessels. Default: c("pLCX", "dLCX",            "LPDA", "LPL",            "OM1", "OM2", "OM3", "OM4", "OM5") rca_vessel_segments Name vessel segments `vessel_name_column` grouped right coronary artery RCA. Default: c("pRCA", "mRCA", "dRCA", "RPDA", "RPL")

title: Get number of vessels with high stenosis severity — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity
text: integer 0 4 indicating number vessels stenosis severity 50

title: Get number of vessels with high stenosis severity — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity
text: Cury et. al. (2022), Society Cardiovascular Computed Tomography (SCCT) graded luminal stenosis follows: Normal (0% stenosis) Minimal (1 24% stenosis) Mild (25 49% stenosis) Moderate (50 69% stenosis) Severe (70 99% stenosis) Occluded (100% stenosis) note LM considered vessel.

title: Get number of vessels with high stenosis severity — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity
code: zero_vessel_disease_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~coronary_vessel_segments, ~vessel_severity,   "LM", "Normal",   "pLAD", "Normal",   "mLAD", "Normal",   "dLAD", "Normal",   "Diag1", "Normal",   "Diag2", "Normal",   "Ramus", "Normal",   "pLCX", "Normal",   "dLCX", "Normal",   "OM1", "Normal",   "OM2", "Normal",   "pRCA", "Normal",   "mRCA", "Normal",   "dRCA", "Normal",   "RPDA", "Normal",   "RPL", "Normal")  four_vessel_disease_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~coronary_vessel_segments, ~vessel_severity,   "LM", "Severe",   "pLAD", "Severe",   "mLAD", "Minimal",   "dLAD", "Occluded",   "Diag1", "Normal",   "Diag2", "Normal",   "Diag3", "Normal",   "Diag4", "Normal",   "pLCX", "Moderate",   "dLCX", "Moderate",   "OM1", "Normal",   "OM2", "Normal",   "pRCA", "Normal",   "mRCA", "Severe",   "dRCA", "Mild",   "RPDA", "Normal",   "RPL", "Normal")   zero_disease_vessel <- get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity(    vessel_data = zero_vessel_disease_data,    vessel_name_column = "coronary_vessel_segments",    stenosis_severity_grp_column = "vessel_severity",    lad_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LAD",    lcx_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LCX",    rca_vessel_segments_grp_name = "RCA",    lad_vessel_segments = c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD",                            "Diag1", "Diag2", "Ramus"),    lcx_vessel_segments = c("pLCX", "dLCX", "OM1", "OM2"),    rca_vessel_segments = c("pRCA", "mRCA", "dRCA", "RPDA", "RPL")    )   four_disease_vessels <- get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity(    vessel_data = four_vessel_disease_data,    vessel_name_column = "coronary_vessel_segments",    stenosis_severity_grp_column = "vessel_severity",    lad_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LAD",    lcx_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LCX",    rca_vessel_segments_grp_name = "RCA",    lad_vessel_segments = c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD",                            "Diag1", "Diag2", "Ramus"),    lcx_vessel_segments = c("pLCX", "dLCX", "OM1", "OM2"),    rca_vessel_segments = c("pRCA", "mRCA", "dRCA", "RPDA", "RPL")    )   zero_disease_vessel #> [1] 0   four_disease_vessels #> [1] 4

title: Get Number Of Vessels With High Stenosis Severity (Excluding LM) — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity_exclude_LM
text: vessel_data Input coronary vessel data vessel_name_column Column `vessel_data` indicating different vessel segments LM, LAD, LCX RCA. stenosis_severity_grp_column Column `vessel_data` indicating severity level different coronary vessels. Accepted severity levels Normal (0% stenosis) Minimal (1 24% stenosis) Mild (25 49% stenosis) Moderate (50 69% stenosis) Severe (70 99% stenosis) Occluded (100% stenosis) lad_vessel_segments_grp_name Name vessel segment group indicate left anterior descending LAD vessels. Default: 'LAD' lcx_vessel_segments_grp_name Name vessel segment group indicate left circumflex LCX vessels. Default: 'LCX' rca_vessel_segments_grp_name Name vessel segment group indicate right coronary artery RCA. Default: 'RCA' lad_vessel_segments Name vessel segments `vessel_name_column` grouped left anterior descending LAD vessels. Default: c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD", "Diag1",            "Diag2", "Diag3", "Diag4",            "Ramus1", "Ramus2") lcx_vessel_segments Name vessel segments `vessel_name_column` grouped left circumflex LCX vessels. Default: c("pLCX", "dLCX",            "LPDA", "LPL",            "OM1", "OM2", "OM3", "OM4", "OM5") rca_vessel_segments Name vessel segments `vessel_name_column` grouped right coronary artery RCA. Default: c("pRCA", "mRCA", "dRCA", "RPDA", "RPL")

title: Get Number Of Vessels With High Stenosis Severity (Excluding LM) — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity_exclude_LM
text: Cury et. al. (2022), Society Cardiovascular Computed Tomography (SCCT) graded luminal stenosis follows: Normal (0% stenosis) Minimal (1 24% stenosis) Mild (25 49% stenosis) Moderate (50 69% stenosis) Severe (70 99% stenosis) Occluded (100% stenosis) note LM considered vessel.

title: Get Number Of Vessels With High Stenosis Severity (Excluding LM) — get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity_exclude_LM
code: zero_vessel_disease_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~coronary_vessel_segments, ~vessel_severity,   "LM", "Normal",   "pLAD", "Normal",   "mLAD", "Normal",   "dLAD", "Normal",   "Diag1", "Normal",   "Diag2", "Normal",   "Ramus", "Normal",   "pLCX", "Normal",   "dLCX", "Normal",   "OM1", "Normal",   "OM2", "Normal",   "pRCA", "Normal",   "mRCA", "Normal",   "dRCA", "Normal",   "RPDA", "Normal",   "RPL", "Normal")  four_vessel_disease_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~coronary_vessel_segments, ~vessel_severity,   "LM", "Severe",   "pLAD", "Severe",   "mLAD", "Minimal",   "dLAD", "Occluded",   "Diag1", "Normal",   "Diag2", "Normal",   "Diag3", "Normal",   "Diag4", "Normal",   "pLCX", "Moderate",   "dLCX", "Moderate",   "OM1", "Normal",   "OM2", "Normal",   "pRCA", "Normal",   "mRCA", "Severe",   "dRCA", "Mild",   "RPDA", "Normal",   "RPL", "Normal")   zero_disease_vessel <- get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity_exclude_LM(    vessel_data = zero_vessel_disease_data,    vessel_name_column = "coronary_vessel_segments",    stenosis_severity_grp_column = "vessel_severity",    lad_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LAD",    lcx_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LCX",    rca_vessel_segments_grp_name = "RCA",    lad_vessel_segments = c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD",                            "Diag1", "Diag2", "Ramus"),    lcx_vessel_segments = c("pLCX", "dLCX", "OM1", "OM2"),    rca_vessel_segments = c("pRCA", "mRCA", "dRCA", "RPDA", "RPL")    )   four_disease_vessels <- get_number_of_vessels_with_high_stenosis_severity_exclude_LM(    vessel_data = four_vessel_disease_data,    vessel_name_column = "coronary_vessel_segments",    stenosis_severity_grp_column = "vessel_severity",    lad_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LAD",    lcx_vessel_segments_grp_name = "LCX",    rca_vessel_segments_grp_name = "RCA",    lad_vessel_segments = c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD",                            "Diag1", "Diag2", "Ramus"),    lcx_vessel_segments = c("pLCX", "dLCX", "OM1", "OM2"),    rca_vessel_segments = c("pRCA", "mRCA", "dRCA", "RPDA", "RPL")    )   zero_disease_vessel #> [1] 0   four_disease_vessels #> [1] 3

title: Print Quarto Version — get_quarto_version
text: function gives information version Quarto used location. name get_quarto_version

title: Print Quarto Version — get_quarto_version
code: get_quarto_version(test_sys_path = FALSE, test_no_path = FALSE)

title: Print Quarto Version — get_quarto_version
text: test_sys_path Set TRUE want test program finding Quarto system environment. Default: FALSE test_no_path Set TRUE want test path Quarto exist. Default: FALSE

title: Print Quarto Version — get_quarto_version
text: vector text indicating Quarto version found computer.

title: Print Quarto Version — get_quarto_version
code: quarto_version <- get_quarto_version()

title: Get R Package Information — get_r_package_info
text: function gives information loaded libraries used script project.

title: Get R Package Information — get_r_package_info
code: get_r_package_info()

title: Get R Package Information — get_r_package_info
text: tibble four columns `package`, `version`, `date` `source`. `package`: name loaded package. `version`: version number loaded package. `date`: date loaded package installed. `source`: source loaded package installed.

title: Get R Package Information — get_r_package_info
code: library("dplyr") #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  r_package_info <- get_r_package_info()  r_package_info #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   package       version    date       source #>   <chr>         <chr>      <chr>      <chr>  #> 1 dplyr         1.1.4      2023-11-17 RSPM   #> 2 harmonisation 0.0.0.9999 2025-03-12 local  #> 3 knitr         1.49       2024-11-08 RSPM

title: Get R Platform Information — get_r_platform_info
text: function gives information R platform environment used script project.

title: Get R Platform Information — get_r_platform_info
code: get_r_platform_info()

title: Get R Platform Information — get_r_platform_info
text: tibble two columns `setting`, `value`. `setting`: name settings like R version, OS, etc. `value`: value setting. Usually version number settings.

title: Get R Platform Information — get_r_platform_info
code: r_platform_table <- get_r_platform_info

title: Is Integer Value — is_integer_value
text: Function check input value integer.

title: Is Integer Value — is_integer_value
code: is_integer_value(input_value, allow_na = FALSE)

title: Is Integer Value — is_integer_value
text: input_value input value allow_na true, NA values ignored output considered TRUE. Default: FALSE

title: Is Integer Value — is_integer_value
text: boolean indicating TRUE input value integer FALSE otherwise.

title: Is Integer Value — is_integer_value
code: # An integer is_integer_value(1) #> [1] TRUE  # Not an integer is_integer_value(1.1) #> [1] FALSE  # Not numeric is_integer_value("1") #> [1] FALSE  # NA cases is_integer_value(NA, allow_na = FALSE) #> [1] FALSE is_integer_value(NA, allow_na = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE

title: Is Integer Vector — is_integer_vector
text: Function check input vector contains integers.

title: Is Integer Vector — is_integer_vector
code: is_integer_vector(input_vector, allow_na = FALSE)

title: Is Integer Vector — is_integer_vector
text: input_vector input vector allow_na true, NA values ignored output considered TRUE. Default: FALSE

title: Is Integer Vector — is_integer_vector
text: boolean vector indicating TRUE input element integer FALSE otherwise.

title: Is Integer Vector — is_integer_vector
text: assume input vector numeric. , elements given FALSE value.

title: Is Integer Vector — is_integer_vector
code: # An integer is_integer_vector(c(1, 2, 3)) #> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE  # Not an integer is_integer_vector(c(1.1, 2, 3)) #> [1] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  # Not numeric vector # R converts c(1, 2, "3") to c("1", "2", "3") is_integer_vector(c(1, 2, "3")) #> [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE  # NA cases is_integer_vector(c(1, NA, 3), allow_na = FALSE) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE is_integer_vector(c(1, NA, 3), allow_na = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE

what: Reactable With Download CSV Button — reactable_with_download_csv_button
title: Reactable With Download CSV Button — reactable_with_download_csv_button
text: function converts simple tibble dataframe reactable download csv button

title: Reactable With Download CSV Button — reactable_with_download_csv_button
code: reactable_with_download_csv_button(input_data, download_file_name = "download")

title: Reactable With Download CSV Button — reactable_with_download_csv_button
text: input_data Input simple dataframe tibble nested data download_file_name Name csv file download csv button clicked Default: NULL

title: Reactable With Download CSV Button — reactable_with_download_csv_button
text: interactive table `input_data` download csv button. medical_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~unique_id, ~medications, ~medication_fixed,   "1", "Medication 1", "Fixed Medication 1",   "2", "Medication 2", "Fixed Medication 2" ) medical_table <- medical_data |>   reactable_with_download_csv_button(     factor_columns = c("unique_id", "medications",                        "medication_fixed")     download_file_name = "download"   )

title: Round To Nearest Digit — round_to_nearest_digit
text: function symmetric rounding nearest digits.

title: Round To Nearest Digit — round_to_nearest_digit
code: round_to_nearest_digit(number, digits = 0)

title: Round To Nearest Digit — round_to_nearest_digit
text: number Input numeric value digits Input integer indicating number decimal places used. default, symmetrically rounds nearest integer. Default: 0

title: Round To Nearest Digit — round_to_nearest_digit
code: round_to_nearest_digit(0.5) #> [1] 1 round_to_nearest_digit(1.5) #> [1] 2 round_to_nearest_digit(-0.5) #> [1] -1 round_to_nearest_digit(-1.5) #> [1] -2

title: Summarise Vessel Segments Severity — summarise_vessel_segments_severity
text: Summarise vessel segments severity picking highest level stenosis severity segments.

title: Summarise Vessel Segments Severity — summarise_vessel_segments_severity
code: summarise_vessel_segments_severity(   vessel_data,   vessel_name_column,   stenosis_severity_grp_column,   vessel_segments_grp_name = "LAD",   vessel_segments = c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD") )

title: Summarise Vessel Segments Severity — summarise_vessel_segments_severity
text: vessel_data Input coronary vessel data two columns `vessel_name_column` `stenosis_severity_grp_column`. vessel_name_column Column `vessel_data` indicating different vessel segments. stenosis_severity_grp_column Column `vessel_data` indicating severity level different coronary vessels. Accepted severity levels Normal (0% stenosis) Minimal (1 24% stenosis) Mild (25 49% stenosis) Moderate (50 69% stenosis) Severe (70 99% stenosis) Occluded (100% stenosis) vessel_segments_grp_name text indicating group name vessel segments summarised. Default: "LAD" vessel_segments character vector indicating vessel segments interest summarise. value found column `vessel_name_column`. Default: c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD")

title: Summarise Vessel Segments Severity — summarise_vessel_segments_severity
text: `vessel_data` rows indicated vessel segments `vessel_segments` column `vessel_name_column` removed. new row corresponding `vessel_segments_grp_name` summarised stenosis severity added.

title: Summarise Vessel Segments Severity — summarise_vessel_segments_severity
text: Cury et. al. (2022), Society Cardiovascular Computed Tomography (SCCT) graded luminal stenosis follows: Normal (0% stenosis) Minimal (1 24% stenosis) Mild (25 49% stenosis) Moderate (50 69% stenosis) Severe (70 99% stenosis) Occluded (100% stenosis) [get_max_stenosis_severity()] used obtain highest stenosis severity provided vessel segments.

title: Summarise Vessel Segments Severity — summarise_vessel_segments_severity
code: occluded_vessel_segment_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~coronary_vessel_segments, ~vessel_severity,   "LM", "Normal",   "pLAD", "Severe",   "mLAD", "Minimal",   "dLAD", "Occluded" )  stenosis_severity <- summarise_vessel_segments_severity(   occluded_vessel_segment_data,   "coronary_vessel_segments",   "vessel_severity",   "LAD",   c("pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD") )  stenosis_severity #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   coronary_vessel_segments vessel_severity #>   <chr>                    <chr>           #> 1 LM                       Normal          #> 2 LAD                      Occluded

title: View Stenosis Summary — view_stenosis_summary
text: wrapper function display interactive table see stenosis summary.

title: View Stenosis Summary — view_stenosis_summary
code: view_stenosis_summary(   input_stenosis_summary,   stenosis_data_column,   download_file_name = "stenosis_summarised_results" )

title: View Stenosis Summary — view_stenosis_summary
text: input_stenosis_summary Input stenosis summary. contain one nested column representing list stenosis data sets. stenosis_data_column Input nested column name `input_stenosis_summary` indicating stenosis data sets. download_file_name Name stenosis summary csv file download button clicked. Default: stenosis_summarised_results

title: View Stenosis Summary — view_stenosis_summary
text: interactive table `input_stenosis_summary`

title: View Stenosis Summary — view_stenosis_summary
code: zero_vessel_disease_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~coronary_vessel_segments, ~vessel_severity,   "LM", "Normal",   "pLAD", "Normal",   "mLAD", "Normal",   "dLAD", "Normal",   "Diag1", "Normal",   "Diag2", "Normal",   "Ramus", "Normal",   "pLCX", "Normal",   "dLCX", "Normal",   "OM1", "Normal",   "OM2", "Normal",   "pRCA", "Normal",   "mRCA", "Normal",   "dRCA", "Normal",   "RPDA", "Normal",   "RPL", "Normal")  three_vessel_disease_data <- tibble::tribble(   ~coronary_vessel_segments, ~vessel_severity,   "LM", "Normal",   "pLAD", "Severe",   "mLAD", "Minimal",   "dLAD", "Occluded",   "Diag1", "Normal",   "Diag2", "Normal",   "Ramus", "Normal",   "pLCX", "Moderate",   "dLCX", "Moderate",   "OM1", "Normal",   "OM2", "Normal",   "pRCA", "Normal",   "mRCA", "Severe",   "dRCA", "Mild",   "RPDA", "Normal",   "RPL", "Normal")  stenosis_summary <- tibble::tibble(   unique_id = c("1", "2"),   stenosis_data = list(zero_vessel_disease_data,                        three_vessel_disease_data),   number_of_vessel_disease = c(0, 3) )  stenosis_table <- stenosis_summary |>   view_stenosis_summary(     stenosis_data_column = "stenosis_data"   )

title: Write To Excel Sheet — write_to_sheet
text: Write data excel sheet.

title: Write To Excel Sheet — write_to_sheet
code: write_to_sheet(sheet_name, data, workbook)

title: Write To Excel Sheet — write_to_sheet
text: sheet_name vector characters representing sheet names Excel file. data list tibble data frame representing data needed output Excel file. workbook Workbook object created using `openxlsx::createWorkbook`.

title: Write To Excel Sheet — write_to_sheet
code: coronary_vessel_segments <- c(   "LM", "pLAD", "mLAD", "dLAD",   "pLCX", "dLCX", "pRCA", "mRCA", "dRCA" )  vessel_severity <- c(   "Severe", "Severe", "Minimal", "Occluded",   "Moderate", "Moderate", "Normal", "Severe", "Mild" )  vessel_disease_data <- data.frame(   coronary_vessel_segments = coronary_vessel_segments,   vessel_severity = vessel_severity )  # Create a new workbook my_workbook <- openxlsx::createWorkbook()  sheet_name = c("vessel disease") output_data = vessel_disease_data  write_to_sheet(sheet_name = sheet_name,                data = output_data,                workbook = my_workbook)
